events.name: [Professional Talk] Internet of Everything- Smart City, Applications & Approach
events.description: “The Internet of Everything is a $19 trillion global opportunity over the next decade: Private-sector firms can create as much as $14.4 trillion of value while cities, governments and other public-sector organizations can create $4.6 trillion”- Cisco Indian Institute of Technology, Alumni Association Singapore-entrepreneurship Cell (IITAAS- eCell) and AllThingsConnected-Alliance, Singapore Meetup (ATCAlliance) invite you to a Professional Talk on Internet of Everything- Smart City, Applications and Approach. If you are an individual, an application developer, a researcher, a startup, or an industry expert working in this exciting area; you will certainly be benefited hearing our two expert speakers. REGISTER HERE: SESSION 1 - The “E Pluribus Unum” Agenda for Mobiles, Wearables & IoT Dr. Archan Misra (Associate Professor of Information Systems) Dr Archan will highlight the trends in urban mobile analytics and applications. Then share work at SMU and elsewhere related to the use of crowd-sourcing for a variety of urban applications, ranging from retail management, logistics and smart campus monitoring. Also, how these capabilities can be combined with the recent emergence of IoT/infrastructure platforms (e.g., BLE beacons). Profile SESSION 2 - Cisco’s approach on Smart City & Nation- Technology and Platforms for application development Jared Danaraj (Director, Industry Solutions and Ecosystems, APJC) Jared manages the regional GTM strategy for Industry Strategic Partnerships in key sectors such as Manufacturing, Energy & Power, Cities and Transportation. He also leads Cisco's Internet of Everything (IoE) Solutions GTM with partners in APJC. Profile WHEN Monday, 6th April’15: 6:30pm- 8:30pm · 6:30- 7:00pm- Networking & Introduction · 7:00- 7:30pm- Session 1 · 7:30- 7:45pm- Break and Networking · 7:45- 8:15pm- Session 2 · 8:15- 8:30pm- Q & A WHERE Venue Sponsor- School of Information Systems, SMU · SIS Seminar Room 2-4, Level 2, School of Information System, SMU, 80 Stamford Road, Singapore[masked] · Map- http://tinyurl.com/kyzm93d REGISTER HERE: We would like to thank the speakers on behalf of organisers for providing their invaluable time, and participating in our efforts to bring you this series of talks on this exciting area of All Things Connected. Note: While this is a free talk, and we would like to have as many as participants possible to accomodate- but seats are obviously limited. We seek your understanding to register only if you are sure to attend the talk, this is to avoid any disappointments to the others, the organisers and the speakers. - Organising team
events.location: School of Information System, SMU, SIS Seminar Room 2-4, Level 2,School of Information System, SMU, 80 Stamford Road, Singapore

events.name: Coding Dojo + Q & A with Bill Venners
events.description: By popular demand, it's time for a bit of Dojo coding again. The problem is available at: https://github.com/SingaporeScalaProgrammers/gokata If you are just beginning to learn Scala, this is a great way to learn from more experienced developers in friendly environment. If you are a pro then this is a great opportunity to flex your skills and make everyone see how super-awesome you truly are. So there is something for everyone see.. As an added bonus, Bill Venners, the lead designer and developer of ScalaTest, renowned author and speaker will be dropping in via Skype to answer your questions. Still not enough? Ok then, everyone who attends will get a free copy of a new Scala testing tool called SuperSafe! Phew... See you all there
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: Public Lecture: Are we really alone? Computational perspective
events.description:
Synopsis  
Are we really alone? How many times you consider this question? And how many times you consider that we are actually ALONE? If we are not ALONE than where are they? Where are their mobile phones, internet and computers? An important part of understanding the likelihood of other life in the Universe is to establish the similarity, or otherwise, of our astronomical environment, which we know to support life, with that of the rest of the Universe. Although our current knowledge suffers from various selection effects, it is nevertheless possible to examine the similarity of our local and extended neighbourhood to that of the rest of the Universe.
events.location: TMC Academy, Lecturer Theatre, , 250 Middle Rd, Singapore 188983

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Websites
events.description: The SingaporeJS book club is back! This time we will be reading the book High Performance Web Sites together. Here is the description about the book: Want your web site to display more quickly? This book presents 14 specific rules that will cut 25% to 50% off response time when users request a page. Author Steve Souders, in his job as Chief Performance Yahoo!, collected these best practices while optimizing some of the most-visited pages on the Web. Even sites that had already been highly optimized, such as Yahoo! Search and the Yahoo! Front Page, were able to benefit from these surprisingly simple performance guidelines. The rules in High Performance Web Sites explain how you can optimize the performance of the Ajax, CSS, JavaScript, Flash, and images that you've already built into your site -- adjustments that are critical for any rich web application. Other sources of information pay a lot of attention to tuning web servers, databases, and hardware, but the bulk of display time is taken up on the browser side and by the communication between server and browser. High Performance Web Sites covers every aspect of that process. Format for the book club: 1. Buy the book and read the Chapter BEFORE the meetup. 2. Pick an Item from the Chapter and prepare some discussion points and/or questions. 3. Let the rest of us know which Item you picked by leaving a comment. We will be reading at Tim & Wei's residence at Tanjong Katong Road. Door opens at 6.30pm. See you there!
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

Snacks will be served!

events.description: If you're curious about the capabilities of WebRTC or Skylink and want to understand better what it does, when to use it and how, this is the training for you. We welcome specifically commercial outlets, outsourcing companies, digital agencies, startups and freelancers that want to understand the technology better and get to know how it can help them creating better experiences in the future and stand out of the competition by being able to embed real-time audio/video communication and low-latency data exchange into apps and websites. Nontheless, everybody is welcome. App and web developers are encouraged to bring their laptop and any other phone/tablet/smartwatch that they'd like to outfit or get to use with WebRTC. Spread the word and forward this to people that you think can benefit from this training! See you soon!

events.name: An Afternoon with Marc Jones, CTO, SoftLayer
events.description: Forget Kick-starting your startup. It’s all about Zooming Ahead! Throw out those Servers, Bring in the Cloud! - Marc Jones, Chief Technology Officer, SoftLayer One of the biggest challenges for startups, no matter how brilliant the idea or, how innovative the app, is dealing with the technical side of business. Not only are you expected to get that out-of-the-box idea, plan for it, seek investors for it but you also have to seek the right technical infrastructure to take it to the masses. Well, who says you have to be technical to get that business off the ground. With everything on the cloud all you need to know about IT systems is click, point, order - and hey presto, your systems are up and running in minutes and hours, not days and months! It’s a Cloud fest - Spend time with Marc Jones as he takes us through what are the latest products in the market and what other startups are doing with the technology. Agenda: 1400 to 1415: Pre-networking 1415 to 1430: Talk by Marc Jones 1430 to 1600: Discussion + Q&A + Networking (Casual) Registration: Plugin @ NUS Enterprise Marc Jones Chief Technology Officer, SoftLayer, an IBM Company Marc Jones leads SoftLayer’s technology design and architecture teams, which focus on the development of new products and services and research and development in SoftLayer Labs. Prior to joining SoftLayer, Jones served as director of software product development for Rackspace’s cloud division.
events.location: Plugin@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent,  #02-18, Singapore 139951

events.name: Interactive Community Security & Data Panel Q&A!
events.description: Edit: PANELISTS: - Eric Meyer (CEO and founder @ Apvera : Adaptive Security Analytics Company) - Dr. NG Wee Keong (Associate Chair @ NTU School of Computer Engineering) Dr.Ng works in privacy-preserving data analytics, encrypted data storage for cloud computing, data mining, and database systems. His publications have appeared in the ACM Transactions on Knowledge Discovery from Data, IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering, ACM Computing Surveys, Data and Knowledge Engineering Journal, and other major journals. - Gary Lim (Chief Security Advisor @ Microsoft) -Stephen Cavey (Cofounder @ Groundlabs : Data Breach Prevention Software for Security Compliance) TOPICS / TALKING POINTS Innovation in Singapore • Cyber Security on enterprises applications, Wearables and IoT. WORKPLACE CHALLENGES • Data Privacy • Using IoT in the workplace • Zero Day • Behavioral Sciences • Machine learning and AI FUTURE OUTLOOK • How the future will be shaped MESSAGE: Hi folks, I am going to kickoff this group with an Event to involve the community, and a panel discussion is the front runner. More information to be confirmed along the way. So far I do have 2 sponsors for this event, our friends at Microsoft and Apvera. And a few panelist from those respected companies as well, If anyone would like to participate as a panelist please reach out to me. Hope to see everyone there! Free shirts and food by the way so snack and meet new people! Thanks! Paul
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Pivotal open source night
events.description: At this meetup we will host two technical talks about software engineering and best practices. One talk will be by - Sergiu Bodiu , a Sr. Solution Architect on the Pivotal team, about building cloud native applications. The other talk will be by Kailash Nath one of our best Hadoop expert at Pivotal Asia. Find details about both talks below: 6:45 - 7:15 :: Food and networking 7:15 - 8:45 :: Talks and Q&A 8:45 - 9:00 :: Mingling -------------- Talk Title: Build Cloud Native applications Speaker: Sergiu Bodiu, Sr. Solution Architect, Pivotal Abstract: There’s a certain “dark ages” between the waning days of Java and .Net and the renaissance we have now with PaaS and other microservices-think driven platforms. "GoldPlating" That's right, friend. Before long, you'll discover that almost any problem can be made more complicated! Tap into the unemptyable wells of PrematureComplexity & AccidentalComplexity, and have a heyday! Fortunately many of the innovators in the space, including Twitter, LinkedIn, and Netflix, have embraced the JVM as they’ve built increasingly complex systems. Spring Cloud provides tools for developers to quickly build some of the common patterns in distributed systems. Spring Boot is a micro framework for micro service applications. With the advent of microservice and cloud-native application architectures, building distributed systems is becoming increasingly common for the enterprise Java developer. About: Sergiu is a seasoned consultant experienced in large-scale e-commerce projects, passionate about providing innovative technology solutions to solve complex business problems, have extensive knowledge and experience delivering enterprise wide applications. ===================== Talk Title: "Implementing Hadoop in a large enterprise - experience sharing" Speaker: Kailash Nath, Technical Architect, Pivotal "Yay! I see the elephant in the room". It took a real long time for those "strategists" to accept the fact that there is an elephant in the room. How many of them really see the full elephant? Business intelligence has been used by architects for assessing architecture model and correct EA strategy all along. And so pattern like distributed computing is nothing new for them. Yet, why Hadoop/big data initiative fail or don't impress while nextgen Silicon valley enterprises make software that is eating the world using these tools? Data analytics use cases are often IT teams view of business rather than business use case defined by business users. If you don't have a big data business use case sponsored by business user, stop your project right now and save money/energy of those highly paid Hadoop experts. About: Kailash is a Technical architect with 14+ years of industry experience. Prior to joining Pivotal, he has lead the big data initiative for a large airline company and has worked 3 years on some of the largest Hadoop projects. His experience includes end to end architecture and design of large scale OLTP system like B2B e-Commerce platform, large scale integrations solutions, mobile commerce platform, high volume OLAP solutions etc.
events.location: PayPal office in Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue Millenia Tower #14-01, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm Metamorphosis By Panagiotis Tomaras and Tom Shellsuit 7.45pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 Enjoy a feast for the eyes and the ears through visual artist Panagiotis Tomaras' stunning video work complemented with sounds by DJ Tom Shellsuit. Presenting an interplay between sight and sound, initial slow, transformative imagery is replaced with rapid, geometric movement, and ends with a vivid treatment of colour inspired by the flicker films of the early 60's. This April, ArtScience Late presents digital art at its best, with music to match. ArtScience Late celebrates Global IoT Day, 9th April 2015 with this digital showcase of art and technology. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.

events.name: Project Showcase by NUS-ISS Master of Technology in Enterprise Business Analytics Graduating Students
events.description:
You are cordially invited to a Project Showcase by our first batch of graduating students of the Master of Technology (MTech) in Enterprise Business Analytics (EBAC) programme. 
Our 40 full-time students will finish their final semester by mid-May, in time for the NUS Commencement ceremony in early July. 
All our students go through internships for eight months as part of their curriculum in the MTech programme. This is the chance for the students to apply business analytics methods and techniques to help organisations solve identified problems. 
And some of them will be showcasing the internship projects and two research projects. 
Project Showcase Details: 
Date: 10 April (Friday) Time: 8am to 2pm Venue: Institute of Systems Science, Level 2 25, Heng Mui Keng Terrace, S119615 (Click HERE for directions) 
Our MTech EBAC programme was launched in January 2014 and designed specifically to satisfy the demands of industry for practical Business Analytics skills and knowledge by developing new practitioners or upgrading entry level practitioners who have a suitable professional background, such as IT professionals. Graduates of the programme are capable of discovering insights from data, applying concepts and techniques to solve major business problems, improving decision-making to increase returns on investments for their organisation and predicting the future profitability of their organisations. Some of our graduating students have been offered roles as business analytics, data scientists and data analysts across industries like health, Infocomm, etc.  
 For more information, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/MTechEBAC/ProjectShowcase.aspx 
  
Please note that this site is not developed nor maintained by the Institute of Systems Science at the National University of Singapore (NUS-ISS).  This is a third party independent site subject to its own data protection and privacy practices and you are encouraged to examine them before proceeding to share your personal data.  NUS-ISS will collect, use and/or disclose the personal data submitted through this third party independent site for the purpose of administration and/or management of the event.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.name: ISS Seminar: Digital Analytics – The Game Changer for the Hospitality Industry
events.description:
Hospitality managers need to enhance the way they make decisions by using actionable insights through the use of digital analytics.  
Online reservations, reviews and ratings in the hospitality industry, have led to the managers owning numerous data. 
But what does the manager do with this data? In order to manage the business well, the manager needs to use the data to answer the many questions that management is interested in. And also to help them make better decisions to increase productivity and sales, and to improve their customers' experience. 
For example, management may be interested in, “Who is likely to be a guest at the hotel and why?”, or “What is the average daily rate per room?”, or “What is the vacancy rate of the hotel?” 
There are many analytical techniques that can answer these business questions. Techniques in “Predictive Analytics”, “Channel Distribution Optimisation”, “Customer Analytics”, “Recommendation Systems”, and others. 
We have invited hospitality experts to tell us how digital analytics can help managers: 

Determine who are their guests and profile them
Understand why guests choose their hotel/airline/restaurant/services
Determine guest satisfaction with their services
Which guests rate their services highly and how to improve guest satisfaction
To design  more effective digital strategy campaigns
Perform comparative analysis among hotels 
Better understand the competitive landscape.

 The hospitality industry is extremely competitive. Managers need to be more proactive in their decision making or their competitors will soon beat them at their own game and become the new leaders in the industry. 
The use of digital analytics is growing in the hospitality industry. Come and learn from hospitality experts, how to make good use of your data when making decisions.  
 Who should attend 
Professionals in the hospitality industry who are interested to find out how their organisations can gain competitive advantage over their competitors by making data-driven decisions.   
 For more information, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/Events/ISSSeminars/DigitalAnalyticsTheGameChangerfortheHospi.aspx 
  
Please note that this site is not developed nor maintained by the Institute of Systems Science at the National University of Singapore (NUS-ISS).  This is a third party independent site subject to its own data protection and privacy practices and you are encouraged to examine them before proceeding to share your personal data.  NUS-ISS will collect, use and/or disclose the personal data submitted through this third party independent site for the purpose of administration and/or management of the event.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.name: Creating and communicating with a BLE device using an Arduino, Raspberry Pi, iOS and Android by @Yeo Kheng Meng
events.description: Kheng Meng: Information about Bluetooth Low Energy(BLE) programming usually revolve around writing code on Android or iOS devices to interact with existing BLE peripherals. Very few involve actually creating your own BLE peripheral itself. After my presentation, you will get an introduction on how to program your own BLE peripheral based on an Arduino or Raspberry Pi. Basic iOS and Android BLE code will also be covered. Kheng Meng is a graduating student from NUS Comp Science faculty; he currently works at AlgoAccess, a med-tech start-up providing solutions to Opticians, Optometrists and Ophthalmologists and he enjoys innovating at the juncture of hardware and software.
events.location: Plug-In@Blk71

events.name: SoftLayer Developer Workshop
events.description: Registration: EventBrite Spend time with SoftLayer mentors and equip your startup's tech teams with the knowledge and technical know-how to scale your technical needs with efficiency and stability. This module will be led by Phil Jackson . Phil is SoftLayer's Lead Developer Evangelist and is based in Dallas, Texas. Managing Deployments Using the SoftLayer API, Docker and Salt Use the SoftLayer API to provision servers, configure SSH keys, and manage nodes in a Docker managed application environment. Learn about Salt configuration management, Docker applications, and the SoftLayer command line utility. Then, build a blog server using these tools. Phil Jackson Lead Developer Advocate As Softlayer’s lead developer advocate, Phil Jackson helps customers and partners integrate with the company’s API. He also architects SoftLayer’s Drupal websites, writes API documentation, and maintains the developer blog.
events.location: M2 Academy, 1 Orchard Road Singapore, 238824

events.name: Apr/2015 - Open Space (Development Practices & Craftsmanship)
events.description: It is about time that we do this theme as at some point in time, someone has to code. =) Open Space Theme: Development Practices & Craftsmanship The following are a few focuses and not limited to: • Fundamental practices , including design patterns, design principles, refactoring, and the various forms of test first development. Issues of interest to polyglot programmers also encouraged. • Software Craftsmanship , including code quality, fundamental creation practices, multi-paradigm programming, responding to change, reducing rework, making the most of a career in software development, and learning how to build better software. • In-depth technical topics , including async programming, developing for and with the cloud, continuous anything, and interesting data topics are all highly valued. More information can be found from the Agile2015 AgileAlliance website . Agenda 7:00pm - Food 7:30pm - Generate topics and schedule 8:00pm - Breakout to topic sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) .
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: எதிர்காலத் தொழில்நுட்பங்கள் வழி தமிழ்-ஓர் உன்னதமான கற்றல் அனுபவம் Tamil through futuristic Technologies - An elegant learning experience
events.description:
This programme using new media is created to help those who are keen to learn to develop i-books, augmented reality and application development  to enhance their proficiency in Tamil language. 
The programme will be held at Paya Lebar Lifelong Centre. It will give the students a state of the arts to experience the usage of Tamil in latest technological advancements. 
To enable effective interactive learning, this programme will be facilitated using latest tools and technology.  
In addition, participants will be exposed to the development of digital contnetnts using virtual reality and creations of 3D gaming features with futuristic aspects. 
 The programme will also guide them in the use of free applications to enhance their learning and writing 1-Books in Tamil. 
At the end of this programme, participants will appreciate the benefits of using new media to actively learn and engage with the Tamil language. 
  
 One iPad and free airtickets and other gifts are waiting for the innovative ideas from students who can demostrate your views about HOW Tamil can be improved using Technology by next 25 years.Prepare share your dreams! 
  
Programme overview 
1.Showcase the development of i-books 
Using online development concepts, the participants will design and showcase their ideas in designing a Tamil book that include, audio, video, interactive elements and Tamil reading aspects. 
2. Tamil App Development 
Tamil for Non Tamil app development will be showcased. Ace Ventures Pte Ltd will colloborate to explain the features of Tamil app devlelopment from original conetent written by respected tamil Scolar Mr. Thinnappan. 
  
3. Augentemented Reality and Tamil 
  
Through digital applications, the facilitator will exhibit the interactive aspects of augmented reality to enrich Tamil language. Live demostration of creating content will be shared with particpants 
  
In overview 
the programme will showcase how language and technology can be merged together to gain the appreciation of the young generation of Tamil and the future opportunities available in Singapore in arts arena. 
  
Participants with innovative ideas will have a chance to win attractive prizes including ipad and samsung devices.
events.location: 11 Eunos Rd 8, , 11 Eunos Road 8, EH2-1 level2, Singapore 408601

events.name: Docker Open-Source-a-thon
events.description: The Docker Project, the open platform for distributed applications, is organizing an open-source-a-thon. The Docker Project, the open platform for distributed applications, announced it will be organizing an open-source-a-thon where Docker core team members will teach and mentor people in how to contribute to open source. Contributions include code, documentation, tutorials, videos, and mentoring. Each contribution to the Docker Project will also support the Oceanic Society and its mission to conserve oceans. https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/9TUPu8HhBrr7DIDpX1o96dkM3SpW0py7zmVwq6PpCFw807kV-huO0IOA4gCN3rnUf7ldUT8nG89c7xn8dUPkRczicz2Ep597ydj4BSfRabK3Z2J_oaIXUJ0JLeoY9Dsp_COhDxc The program is timed to coincide with the project’s 2nd birthday and is focused on a cause – ocean and marine life health – that is important to its millions of users. Docker’s logo, Moby Dock, is a blue whale that was contributed and selected by its community. The charitable program starts on March 23 and will span a total of five weeks; part of the proceeds will go towards the adoption and naming of a female blue whale soon to be known as “Molly Dock.” Contributions from the “opening week” of the program and follow-on contributions over the subsequent four weeks will be calculated and the final donation will be made. One contribution equates to a $50 donation, and an additional $50 will be added to the “Molly Dock fund” for those that wish to continue to contribute. As we get closer to the event, more information will be added to docker.party ! Agenda: 3:00 - Doors Open 3:15 to 3:45 - Introduction & Presentation on contributing to the Docker Open Source project 3:45 to 7:30 - Break out into groups. 1) Non code contributions 2) Beginner Code contributions (either new to Go or Docker) 3) Advanced Code contributions (advanced users are encouraged to mentor #2 as well) 7:30 to 8:00 Snacks and socializing Sponsors

events.name: Future Of Health
events.description:
The Future of Health event will feature 2 speakers focusing on how technological advances are bringing about changes that will impact our health. 
  
1. What is wrong with healthcare?  By: Balaji Venkatesan 
Balaji Venkatesan is currently heading product development for Zuellig Pharma Patient solutions. 
Balaji is a staunch believer in the transformational nature of technology. Transformation of individuals and organizations are his key areas of interest. He has over 20 years of experience in business and technology. He is constantly looking for new ways in which technology can benefit businesses and individuals.An active participant in the QS, Futurists & other tech groups. 
In this talk, Balaji will give a view into the many areas in which exponential technology is revolutionizing health-care. 
2. Transformation of healthcare By:  Julien de Salaberry 
Julien is the founder of The Propell Group and has over 15 years of experience in healthcare with leading brands including Eli Lilly, Boston Scientific, Baxter, GSK, Merck&Co. He is also an advisor to startups and incubators in healthcare and technology in emerging high growth markets as well as being a private investor in early stage and promising SMEs. 
Julien has recently co-written iDisrupted (published in November 2014), which focuses on creating an understanding of the significant technological changes that, are just beginning to re-shape our daily lives. 
He is also, together with his partners, currently launching HealthStartups Asia, which aims to create greater momentum in the Asia healthtech space by raising the visibility of exciting new startups which have set out to transform health services by leveraging digital technology in the Asia-Pacific markets. 
Julien will provide a deeper look into the digital health space, in particular how sensors, algorithms and data are transforming health-care.
events.location: IDA Labs @ National Design Centre, , 111 Middle Rd, #03-04, Singapore 188969

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. events.name: SCADA security, Hardcore stuff i hack and Encrypted Databases in Cloud
events.description: As usual, we will have our null Singapore, Monthly meet up on 3rd Thursday i.e., 16th April 2015. Agenda ( 40 min talk each) : Introduction to Null singapore ( 10 mins ) by Imran Vulnerability Assessments on SCADA Systems – Outsmarting the Smart Grid by Fadli B. Sidek Encrypted Databases for Untrusted Cloud by Vasily Sidorov The Hardcore Stuff I Hack by Paul Craig ( Order of the talk might vary ) Abstract of the talk(s): Encrypted Databases for Untrusted Cloud 1. security threats we face in the cloud 2. common approaches to database security 3. challenges of operating an encrypted database 4. how it can be done and what is the price of security in this case The Hardcore Stuff I Hack: This talk is going to give a run through of some of the technical challenges myself and my team have overcome over the years - in as much hardcore detail as possible. Vulnerability Assessments on SCADA Systems – Outsmarting the Smart Grid : SCADA assessments has been on the news and the talk of the town since 2005. While there are many talks and demonstrations about how to penetrate and exploit SCADA systems, little discussions about the pre-exploitation phase were being shared and discussed. In this talk, i am going to share my experience on how i performed my assessment for a huge smart grid facility consisting of more than 30 sites. I will cover how i did the assessment for both onsite as well as remote and how i accidentally brought down a whole operation center. This talk will also share the lessons learned and how to develop a proper methodology and process in performing vulnerability assessment on a network of SCADA systems. Speaker(s) Bio: Fadli B. Sidek is a Cyber Security enthusiast and currently working at a security company specializing in application security. His experience include performing vulnerability assessments and penetration testing to clients in the AMEA region. He graduated from Murdoch University, Australia with a Double Majors Degree in Cyber Forensics, Information Security Management and Business Information System. He has over 9 years of experience in IT and Security and has written and published security articles in Pentestmag and Hakin9 and has spoken at several security conferences in Singapore, India, UAE, Europe and the U.S. Paul Craig, I lead a technical boutique security team in Singapore focusing on hacking "everything with a flashing light" for some of the largest brand companies in Singapore. I've been doing it like this for 11 years, and as i often say "Hacking is the only thing i do well". This talk is going to give a run through of some of the technical challenges myself and my team have overcome over the years - in as much hardcore detail as possible. Vasily Sidorov is a researcher and PhD candidate with Data-Intensive Scalable Computng (DISCO) Lab at Nanyang Technological University, Sch. of Comp. Eng., since 2011. Was awarded a MOE AcRF Tier 1 research grant for his project. Holds MSc degree in Maths and CompSci, and another MSc degree in Business Mgmt and HR, both from Lomonosov Moscow State University, Russia Follow us on twitter @nullsingapore. - Null Singapore
events.location: Thought Works,  Level 3, 87B Amoy Street, 069906, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: How to measure user experience and reduce abandonment by more than 30%
events.description:
Whether you are well established e-Commerce brand such as Zalora, Agoda or a small business with a web shop, it’s never too late to gain more insights into your customers’ end user experience to make better decisions on where next to spend engineering and marketing money. 
With the establishment of mobile web and native mobile apps, your website isn't the only customer touch point anymore and it is critical to deliver the same user experience across all the channels (Mobile App/Mobile Web/Web). 
 In order to do that you need to find a way to monitor and measure user experience across your delivery channels to allow both business and engineers to make the right decisions on where to invest time and money to improve user experience. 
Join us, as Andreas Grabner, Technology Strategist at Dynatrace, shares best practices from different global companies and learn:   
- which metrics you really need to monitor across your channels  
-how to make data-driven decisions based on these metrics  

-changing your deployment model of applications and new features to become metric driven and not just demand driven 
  
This event is supported by Mobile Monday SIngapore.
events.location: The Penny Black, , 27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817

events.name: The 6th SoC Term Project Showcase (STePS)
events.description:
The School of Computing Term Project Showcase (STePS) aims to bring together all of the class-based projects and project modules in the School of Computing (SoC). It's a festive yet serious class showcase, in which students present their projects in all aspects of computer science and information systems to the respective Faculty, Industry guests, Government agencies, Sponsors and Investors for grading, to connect with potential employers and to seek opportunities for further development of their work through collaboration with Industry and Investors. Click  to see the invitation. 
Students, faculty, technology entrepreneurs and prospective students will have the opportunity to experience the innovations created by the students. TEN courses are participating in the Term Project Showcase this semester. Click on the links to see the project details: 

 IS 5126  Hands-On With Business Analytics (Chair: Prof. Tuan Q. Phan)
 CS 3218   Software Engineering on Modern Application Platforms (Chair: Prof. Sim Khe Chai)
 CS 3218  Multimodal Processing in Mobile Platforms (Chair: Prof. Ng Teck Khim)
 CS 3240  Interaction Design (Chair: Dr. Bimlesh Wadhwa)
 CS 3247  Game Development (Chair: Dr. Bhojan Anand)
 CS 3284  Media Technology Project II (Chair: Prof. Leow Wee-Kheng)
 CS 4244  Knowledge-Based Systems (Chair: Prof. Tan Chew Lim)
 CS 4344  Networked and Mobile Gaming (Chair: Prof. Ooi wei Tsang)
 CP 3101B  Web programming and Applications (Chair: Dr. Steven Halim)
 Selected FYPs   Final Year Project (Chair: Terrence Sim)

Number of projects: ~100 Number of attendees: ~800  Last date for registration of Standard Tickets with Buffet Dinner: Apr 13, 2015 6:00:00 PM     Event website: http://steps.comp.nus.edu.sg Facebook Page: http://bit.ly/steps6onfb  The event is supported by: 
The event is organised by  NUS School of Compuiting  with strong support from our Industry and Academia partners. 
A quick glance of previous STePS video: http://steps.comp.nus.edu.sg/steps5/video.html 
  
The event is supported by:                                     Platinum Sponsor:

events.name: DataDive: Earth Hour and HOME
events.description: Calling all socially conscious analysts, statisticians, data scientists, coders, hackers and designers! Come join us for a weekend of working with data to do good! RSVP to work alongside experts in the field to analyze, visualize, and mash-up the data from our non-profit partners. If we don't know you already, please tell us a bit more about yourself by filling in this Google form ! Non-Profit Organizations 1) Earth Hour World Wildlife Fund ’s Earth Hour is a global environmental movement with a core vision to create environmental impact by utilizing the power of the crowd. Started seven years ago, Earth Hour has grown to become the world’s largest mass participation event in history: celebrated in over 7,000 cities, across 7 continents and by hundreds of millions of people. Earth Hour will take place around the world on 28 Mar 2015 (Sat, 8.30 - 9.30 pm). 2) Humanitarian Organisation for Migration Economics (HOME) Founded in 2004, the Humanitarian Organization for Migration Economics (HOME) serves the needs of the migrant worker community in Singapore by developing research and education on the socioeconomics of migration in Singapore and the countries of origin, providing social integration services for emigrants and immigrants, and providing humanitarian assistance for the effects of 'crisis' migration. There are more than 1.3 million documented migrant workers or more in Singapore, of which about 1.1 million are low-wage workers. HOME has provided services to more than 50,000 migrant workers through its provision of shelters, legal assistance, health education training and rehabilitative services. Special thanks to Fuji Xerox Singapore for being our venue sponsor! Schedule Friday, Apr 24th 7.15 pm: Doors open, sign-in 7.45 pm: Introduction to Non-Profit Organizations and Datasets 8.15 pm: Pitching for teams 8.30 pm: Formation of teams It's a great chance to learn about the non-profits and their data, meet the other volunteers you'll be working and talk with others from our partner causes. Plus, there will be snacks and drinks! Saturday, Apr 25th 9 am: Doors open, sign-in and breakfast 9.30 am: Brief review from Data Ambassadors, then data diving! 12.30 pm: Lunch 1 pm: Open Roundtables 6 pm: Dinner 9 pm: Everybody goes home for the night Saturday we'll start work on the data! DataDivers will choose which problems they'd like to work on and form teams around their individual questions. There will be roving DataKind project team leads who will help advise on and manage the projects throughout the day. Sunday, Apr 26th 9 am: Doors open, breakfast 12 noon: Presentations from teams to social organizations 2 pm: Another successful DataDive in the books! This is your chance to show the world what you have done with data! There is no expectation of slides or other presentation materials, simply use whatever method of conveying your work to the organizations you feel is best. This is also the chance for our non-profit partners to better understand what your team did. These presentations can be single or group work, but they can be no longer than 10 minutes each. We want to give everyone a chance to speak, and get people out at a reasonable time. Other items of note for the weekend Volunteers at all levels are welcome throughout the weekend . If you're already a pro, we're looking for some subject-area experts to help with project preparation and be resources throughout the DataDive. Unlike a hackathon, the goal is not (necessarily) to create an app, and it is not a competition. Instead, the objective is to work with teams of experts to understand a truly difficult problem through data. You could end up with a visualization, an analysis, some graphs, or even just some new datasets by the end of the event, and all of those are fantastic results! There is a Github repository setup to use for sharing code and analyses during the event . This will be our primary resource for capturing everything developed at the DataDive, so please use it for sharing and collaboration. We do not assign you to a problem . We want you to work with the problem and data you feel most passionate about, so come Friday with an open mind and be ready to learn. You do not have to stay the entire weekend to participate in the event . We hope that you will find a project you can dig into, but you are always welcome to come and go as you please. You do not have to work on the same project for the whole weekend . Again, we hope that you will find a project to work on to completion, but if at any point you feel like you want to change simply let the DataKind project team lead for your team know. We do not provide any hardware or software for you to use . We'll have the data and some services set up (hackpad, Github), but otherwise you should bring your own laptop and come ready to use whatever data tools you like. See you there!
events.location: Fuji Xerox Singapore, 80 Anson Road, Fuji Xerox Towers, S(079907)

events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Nurturing Leonardos
events.description: Nurturing Leonardos Friday 8 and Saturday 9 May 2015 Expression Gallery, Level 4 On 8 and 9 May 2015, ArtScience Museum will host a conference exploring the legacy of history's most celebrated artist and scientist, Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519). Most studies of da Vinci focus on a specific area of his activity - art, anatomy, technology, studies on water, on flight, and so on. This conference will offer a different point of view, encouraging an exploration of da Vinci's way of thinking and of the cultural landscape, which nurtured him. It will analyze how his interdisciplinary approach, which we now refer to as “systems thinking” and "complexity", remains strikingly resonant for us today, and applied within the fields of art, science, technology, architecture and foresight. The conference begins with a special edition of ArtScience Museum's monthly performance programme, ArtScience late (Thursday 7 May), and continues for two full days of discussions on 8-9 May, featuring presentations from within Singapore and around the world, from a range of leading speakers in the fields of science, history, technology, and architecture. The conference chairs are Honor Harger (ArtScience Museum) and Andrea Nanetti (Nanyang Technological University, School of Art, Design and Media and Complexity Institute).
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: PowerShell Forum
events.description: Full details soon! This is a 2 full day event with International Speakers as a build up to the PowerShell Summit 2016. It's the first event of its kind in Asia. This will have a nominal entrance fee (to help cover the huge costs) but there will be great intermediate and advanced content by MVPs and world recognised Experts. Registration will be via a different channel and will open nearer the time but we want to make sure this is in our User Groups schedule on Meet Up also.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989
